docs.snippet: A caption in Weekend yesterday with the Inside Art column misidentified the owner of Leger's 1920 painting "Sleeping Women." It is one of 40 artworks from the Oscar Kolin estate being sold by the Pace Wildenstein gallery; it is not from the Oveta ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A caption in Weekend yesterday with the Inside Art column misidentified the owner of Leger's 1920 painting "Sleeping Women." It is one of 40 artworks from the Oscar Kolin estate being sold by the Pace Wildenstein gallery; it is not from the Oveta Culp Hobby estate.

docs.lead_paragraph: having collected $4,635,538 so far, its second-highest total ever. The fund's record high is $5.08 million in 1991-92. Contributions postmarked no later than today and received by March 8 will be included in this year's campaign. Money received after March 8 will be credited toward next year's drive.

headline.main: Surge in Gifts Lifts Fund To Second-Highest Total

keywords.value: NEW YORK TIMES NEEDIEST CASES FUND

docs.snippet: A Oscar-winning Cambodian actor slain in Los Angeles may have been killed by  agents of the Khmer Rouge, his brother said today.         The accuser, Chan Sarun, said he believed that his brother, Dr. Haing S. Ngor, was killed because of his polit...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Oscar-winning Cambodian actor slain in Los Angeles may have been killed by agents of the Khmer Rouge, his brother said today. The accuser, Chan Sarun, said he believed that his brother, Dr. Haing S. Ngor, was killed because of his political efforts against the Khmer Rouge, which brutally ruled Cambodia two decades ago. On Tuesday the Co-Prime Minister of Cambodia, Hun Sen, described Dr. Ngor as "an activist against the Khmer Rouge," but said there was not enough evidence to implicate the group.

headline.main: World News Briefs;Poltical Motive Alleged In Killing of Cambodian

docs.snippet: On a good snow day, a mountain resort can become as overcrowded as a movie theater showing an Oscar-winning film. Most ski areas make do with longer-than-usual lift lines, but some choose to turn down new arrivals. That can be a headache, too.    ...
docs.lead_paragraph: On a good snow day, a mountain resort can become as overcrowded as a movie theater showing an Oscar-winning film. Most ski areas make do with longer-than-usual lift lines, but some choose to turn down new arrivals. That can be a headache, too. At least 10 resorts in the United States have a policy limiting the number of skiers on a given day. Most sell out as a way of avoiding congestion on the slopes, or in their parking lots. One has to satisfy state capacity limits.

headline.main: So Many Skiers, So Few Slopes

docs.snippet: The vigor and variety of Spanish dance were affirmed on Tuesday night when the National Ballet of Spain opened a two-week season at City Center. The Madrid-based troupe took choreographic looks at many regions and eras and performed every dance wi...
docs.lead_paragraph: The vigor and variety of Spanish dance were affirmed on Tuesday night when the National Ballet of Spain opened a two-week season at City Center. The Madrid-based troupe took choreographic looks at many regions and eras and performed every dance with white-hot intensity. A few words should be said to explain just what sort of company this is. Despite its name, the National Ballet is not primarily a classical ensemble and should not be confused with the Compania Nacional de Danza, the classically trained Madrid group, which performed at City Center in 1994. The National Ballet, which was founded in 1978 and has since had several directors, is eclectic in policy and seeks to preserve and adapt many Spanish dance forms. The company is now directed by Aurora Pons, Nana Lorca and Victoria Eugenia, and previously appeared in New York in 1988.

docs.snippet: MOVE over, "Rocky Horror Picture Show." "Babe" is attracting a cult following, but the endearing movie fable owes its charm not just to its cast of  verbally gifted livestock (Mr. Ed, meet Bambi) but also to its sylvan production setting. The talk...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOVE over, "Rocky Horror Picture Show." "Babe" is attracting a cult following, but the endearing movie fable owes its charm not just to its cast of verbally gifted livestock (Mr. Ed, meet Bambi) but also to its sylvan production setting. The talking-pig story takes place on Farmer Hoggett's too-good-to-be-true thatch-roof farm, which was built from scratch by the production designer Roger Ford in Robertson, Australia -- where real life folksy street signs proclaim: POPULATION : 275 HEIGHT : 730 METERS A TIDY TOWN

docs.snippet: Mexico's shaky political balance was weakened today as opposition leaders threatened to storm out of crucial talks on election reforms to protest what they claimed was an attempt to whitewash the massacre of 17 peasants by police in the state of G...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico's shaky political balance was weakened today as opposition leaders threatened to storm out of crucial talks on election reforms to protest what they claimed was an attempt to whitewash the massacre of 17 peasants by police in the state of Guerrero last June. In his final report to the state congress yesterday, a special state prosecutor, Oscar Alejandro Varela Vidales, concluded that the mass killing was an unfortunate accident caused by poorly trained police officers and not an ambush organized by Government officials, despite considerable evidence to suggest otherwise.

headline.main: Report on Massacre Provokes A Political Storm in Mexico

docs.snippet: Mary Reilly," a drab, somnolent and expensive drama in which Julia Roberts plays the maid in the Jekyll-Hyde household, opened -- and virtually closed -- over the weekend. Its tepid performance at the box office ($2.8 million for a movie that cost...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mary Reilly," a drab, somnolent and expensive drama in which Julia Roberts plays the maid in the Jekyll-Hyde household, opened -- and virtually closed -- over the weekend. Its tepid performance at the box office ($2.8 million for a movie that cost $70 million to make and market) has already tagged the film as not only one of the most visible mishaps of this still-young year but also of Ms. Roberts's career. Whatever the reasons for the flop -- and studio executives insist that Ms. Roberts, who was paid in the $10 million range, was not to blame for a film whose director and writer failed to exploit her wistful charm, her famous smile and her seemingly naive sexuality -- "Mary Reilly" proved yet again that star power in Hollywood is now largely a smoke-and-mirrors concept.

headline.main: Whatever Happened to Box-Office Star Power?

docs.snippet: If the television show "Dynasty" was the paradigm of 1980's fashion, the current hit "Friends" tells quite a different story. Rachel's cardigans, nondescript short skirts and body-by-Rachel T-shirts bespeak a life of languid,  low-key effort. Alex...
docs.lead_paragraph: If the television show "Dynasty" was the paradigm of 1980's fashion, the current hit "Friends" tells quite a different story. Rachel's cardigans, nondescript short skirts and body-by-Rachel T-shirts bespeak a life of languid, low-key effort. Alexis of "Dynasty," on the other hand, with celebrity-size shoulders, pinched waist and towering heels -- cobalt blue and sequins were a favorite combination -- was poised for saber-toothed war. These contrasting images reflect a sea change under way in fashion, spurred by women's and men's cravings for a more relaxed, stress-free life. Casual dress is becoming the custom in every walk of life. But it is a surprising realization, and perhaps cause for worry, that the world's top designers have little to do with it.

headline.main: A Casual Revolution Is Heating Up
